org.opentrafficsim.car.following

Class IDMPlus<Line,C extends Car>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentrafficsim.car.following.IDMPlus<Line,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    Line -
    C - Car;
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CarFollowingModel<C>

    public class IDMPlus<Line,C extends Car>
extends Object
implements CarFollowingModel<C>
    IDMPlus implements the Integrated Lane Change Model with Relaxation and Synchronization as published by Wouter J. Schakel, Victor L. Knoop and Bart van Arem in Transportation Research Record No 2316 pp 47-57, Washington D.C., 2012.
    There are two nasty type setting errors in equation 7 in this published version of the paper. Both times an equals sign (=) after again should not be there.

    Copyright (c) 2013-2014 Delft University of Technology, PO Box 5, 2600 AA, Delft, the Netherlands. All rights reserved.
    BSD-style license. See OpenTrafficSim License.

    Version:
    Jul 4, 2014
    Author:
    Peter Knoppers

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> a
      Longitudinal acceleration [m/s^2].
      protected DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> aMin
      Regular longitudinal acceleration [m/s^2].
      protected DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> b
      Longitudinal deceleration [m/s^2].
      protected DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> b0
      Maximum deceleration when actual speed is more than desired speed (v > vdes).
      protected double dCoop
      LMRS cooperative lane change threshold.
      protected double delta
      Mean speed limit adherence (1.0: mean free speed equals the speed limit; 1.1: mean speed limit equals 110% of the speed limit, etc.).
      protected double dFree
      LMRS free lane change threshold.
      protected double dSync
      LMRS synchronized lane change threshold.
      protected DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit> s0
      Preferred net longitudinal distance when stopped [m].
      protected DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> stepSize
      Time slot size used by IDMPlus (not defined in the paper, but 0.5s is a reasonable trade-off between computational speed and accuracy).
      protected DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> t0
      LMRS mandatory lane change time [s].
      protected DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> tMax
      Longitudinal regular following headway [s].
      protected DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> tSafe
      Safe time headway.
      protected DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> vCong
      LMRS critical speed [m/s] for a speed gain in the right lane.
      protected DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> vGain
      LMRS speed gain [m/s] for full desire.
      protected DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit> x0
      LMRS mandatory lane change distance [m].

      • s0

        protected final DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit> s0
        Preferred net longitudinal distance when stopped [m].

      • a

        protected final DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> a
        Longitudinal acceleration [m/s^2].

      • aMin

        protected final DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> aMin
        Regular longitudinal acceleration [m/s^2].

      • b

        protected final DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> b
        Longitudinal deceleration [m/s^2]. (Should be a positive value even though it is a deceleration.)

      • b0

        protected final DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> b0
        Maximum deceleration when actual speed is more than desired speed (v > vdes). (Should be a positive value even though it is a deceleration.) [m/s^2]

      • tMax

        protected final DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> tMax
        Longitudinal regular following headway [s].

      • dFree

        protected final double dFree
        LMRS free lane change threshold. (Value between 0 and dSync)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dSync

        protected final double dSync
        LMRS synchronized lane change threshold. (Value between dFree and dCoop)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dCoop

        protected final double dCoop
        LMRS cooperative lane change threshold. (Value between dSync and 1.0)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • t0

        protected final DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> t0
        LMRS mandatory lane change time [s].

      • x0

        protected final DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit> x0
        LMRS mandatory lane change distance [m].

      • vGain

        protected final DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> vGain
        LMRS speed gain [m/s] for full desire. (The paper specifies this value in [km/h])

      • vCong

        protected final DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> vCong
        LMRS critical speed [m/s] for a speed gain in the right lane. (The paper specifies this value in [km/h])

      • tSafe

        protected final DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> tSafe
        Safe time headway.

      • delta

        protected final double delta
        Mean speed limit adherence (1.0: mean free speed equals the speed limit; 1.1: mean speed limit equals 110% of the speed limit, etc.).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stepSize

        protected final DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> stepSize
        Time slot size used by IDMPlus (not defined in the paper, but 0.5s is a reasonable trade-off between computational speed and accuracy).

    • Method Detail

      • computeAcceleration

        public final CarFollowingModel.CarFollowingModelResult computeAcceleration(C car,
                                                            Collection<C> leaders,
                                                            DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> speedLimit)
        Compute the acceleration that would be used to follow a set of leaders.
        Specified by:
        computeAcceleration in interface CarFollowingModel<C extends Car>
        Parameters:
        car - the Car for which acceleration is computed
        leaders - Set<Car>; the set of leaders to take into consideration
        speedLimit - DoubleScalarAbs<SpeedUnit>; the local speed limit
        Returns:
        CarFollowingModelResult; the result of application of the car following model

      • computeLaneChangeAndAcceleration

        public final CarFollowingModel.CarFollowingModelResult computeLaneChangeAndAcceleration(C car,
                                                                         Collection<C> sameLaneCars,
                                                                         Collection<C> preferredLaneCars,
                                                                         Collection<C> nonPreferredLaneCars,
                                                                         DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> speedLimit,
                                                                         double preferredLaneRouteIncentive,
                                                                         double nonPreferredLaneRouteIncentive)
                                                                                 throws RemoteException
        Compute the acceleration and lane change.
        Specified by:
        computeLaneChangeAndAcceleration in interface CarFollowingModel<C extends Car>
        Parameters:
        car - Car; the Car for which the acceleration and lane change is computed
        sameLaneCars - Collection<Car>; the set of observable Cars in the current lane (can not be null)
        preferredLaneCars - Collection<Car>; the set of observable Cars in the adjacent lane where cars should drive in the absence of other traffic (must be null if there is no such lane)
        nonPreferredLaneCars - Collection<Car>; the set of observable Cars in the adjacent lane into which cars should merge to overtake other traffic (must be null if there is no such lane)
        speedLimit - DoubleScalarAbs<SpeedUnit>; the local speed limit
        preferredLaneRouteIncentive - Double; route incentive to merge to the adjacent lane where cars should drive in the absence of other traffic
        nonPreferredLaneRouteIncentive - Double; route incentive to merge to the adjacent lane into which cars should merge to overtake other traffic
        Returns:
        CarFollowingModelResult; the result of the lane change and car following model
        Throws:
        RemoteException
